name: brightdata-mcp_search_engine
description: Scrape search results from Google, Bing or Yandex. Returns SERP results in markdown (URL, title, description)

name: brightdata-mcp_scrape_as_markdown
description: Scrape a single webpage URL with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in MarkDown language. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

name: brightdata-mcp_scrape_as_html
description: Scrape a single webpage URL with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in HTML. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

name: brightdata-mcp_extract
description: Scrape a webpage and extract structured data as JSON. First scrapes the page as markdown, then uses AI sampling to convert it to structured JSON format. This tool can unlock any webpage even if it uses bot detection or CAPTCHA.

extraction_prompt.description: Custom prompt to guide the extraction process. If not provided, will extract general structured data from the page.

name: brightdata-mcp_session_stats
description: Tell the user about the tool usage during this session

name: brightdata-mcp_web_data_amazon_product
description:
Quickly read structured amazon product data.
Requires a valid product URL with /dp/ in it.
This can be a cache lookup, so it can be more reliable than scraping

name: brightdata-mcp_web_data_amazon_product_reviews
description:

This can be a cache lookup, so it can be more reliable than scraping

name: brightdata-mcp_web_data_amazon_product_search
description:

This can be a cache lookup, so it can be more reliable than scraping

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_navigate
description: Navigate a scraping browser session to a new URL

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_go_back
description: Go back to the previous page

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_go_forward
description: Go forward to the next page

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_links
description:
Get all links on the current page, text and selectors
It's strongly recommended that you call the links tool to check that your click target is valid

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_click
description:
Click on an element.
Avoid calling this unless you know the element selector (you can use other tools to find those)

selector.description: CSS selector for the element to click

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_type
description: Type text into an element

selector.description: CSS selector for the element to type into

submit.description: Whether to submit the form after typing (press Enter)

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_wait_for
description: Wait for an element to be visible on the page

timeout.description: Maximum time to wait in milliseconds (default: 30000)

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_screenshot
description: Take a screenshot of the current page

full_page.description:
Whether to screenshot the full page (default: false)
You should avoid fullscreen if it's not important, since the images can be quite large

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_get_text
description: Get the text content of the current page

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_get_html
description: Get the HTML content of the current page. Avoid using the full_page option unless it is important to see things like script tags since this can be large

full_page.description:
Whether to get the full page HTML including head and script tags
Avoid this if you only need the extra HTML, since it can be quite large

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_scroll
description: Scroll to the bottom of the current page

name: brightdata-mcp_scraping_browser_scroll_to
description: Scroll to a specific element on the page

selector.description: CSS selector for the element to scroll to
